results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 1.
results.creator_credit: Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: From the producers of “Round the twist” and “Skytrackers” comes a series about a young girl, Penelope Townes who finds a magic opal which contains two genies, Bruce and his son Baz. She thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have everything she wants. Bruce, however has other ideas. The first three episodes of this series are: “Wishing and hoping”, “It’s my opal…and I’ll cry if I want to” and Where it’s at.

results.title: The Genie from down under: wishing and hoping
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When upper class English girl Penelope Townes finds a magic opal which contains two Australian genies, Bruce and his son Baz, she thinks all her problems are over, and that she can have anything she wants. Bruce, however, has other ideas.

results.title: The Genie from down under: where it's at
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Bruce wants to become human but to do this he must take the opal to the cave where it was mined over a hundred years before. He sets out to trick Penelope into visiting the cave.

results.title: The Genie from down under: larceny
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Bruce helps Otto and Conrad get the opal because he thinks they will help him return to Australia. Instead, the von Meisters sell it for 25,000 pounds. It’s now up to the genies to sort the mess out.

results.title: The Genie from down under: it's my opal and I'll cry if I want to
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Tour operator, Otto von Meister, and his nephew, Conrad, arrive at Townes Downs with a load of tourists. When he learns about the opal Otto recalls that it belonged to their family years before and he and Conrad are desperate to get it back.
results.title_for_label: The Genie from down under: it’s my opal and I’ll cry if I want to

results.title: The Genie from down under: good cop, bad genie
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Penelope is desperate to win the Cross Country and she does - without any help from the genies. Penelope wishes that Conrad could see her success. He does - but not quite how Penelope would have liked.

results.title: The Genie from down under: customs
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Swan, Phil Jones, Patricia Edgar, British Broadcasting Corporation, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Penelope, Lady Diana and Miss Mossop are arrested by a Customs Officer when they return to England with 20 million pounds provided by the genies. That exact amount has just gone missing from the Royal Mint.

results.title: The Genie
results.brief_description: A Special Mention in the Junior Live Action category of Screen It 2016. A young boy discovers a book on how to be a genie. Will he use his new powers for good or evil?

results.title: The Genetic takeover
results.creator_credit: Louise Vandelac, Karl Parent, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In just a few short years, genetically modified plants have become part of our daily diet and are already found in 75% of processed foods. This revolution has occurred without consumer awareness and without the knowledge of potential risks to our health and the environment. In response to consumer demands, many European and Asian countries have instituted mandatory labelling of genetically modified foods. North America and Canada however, have been slow to react. This video takes a sober look at a potentially explosive situation. It investigates the issue that industrial giants are willing to ignore basic safety rules in their relentless fight for profits and asks the question: Can food crops, a vital element of the collective wealth of this planet, remain at the mercy of private interests?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Vandelac, Karl Parent, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Genetic chance
results.creator_credit: Robert Reid and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Children My Children”.
Examines the moral and social implications of determining genetic disorders in unborn infants, and looks at the effects of a number of such disorders. Most of the discussion is centred around haemophilia.
